paper_abstract: We investigate the mu-randomness of unions and intersections of random sets under various notions of randomness corresponding to different probability measures. For example, the union of two relativelyMartin-Lof random sets is not Martin-Lof random but is random with respect to the Bernoulli measure lambda(3/4) under which any number belongs to the set with probability 3/4. Conversely, any lambda(3/4) random set is the union of two Martin-Lof random sets. Unions and intersections of random closed sets are also studied.
paper_title: Effective Randomness of Unions and Intersections
